My videos cover topics directly from the syllabus, while the book provides additional in-depth information for a more thorough understanding. If you have the time, studying the book alongside the videos can further enhance your knowledge.

Thank you for your feedback. Just to clarify, our videos strictly adhere to the syllabus for Cambridge IGCSE Biology paper 0610.   If you feel any area is 'missing', please compare the syllabus of your specific paper against the one our videos follow.   You can find the syllabus booklet for IGCSE Biology Paper 0610 for the years 2023-2025 on the Cambridge International website:  https://www.cambridgeinternational.org/programmes-and-qualifications/cambridge-igcse-biology-0610/
Excellent! You are most welcome, keep it up! 👍🏻
You are most welcome and Thank you for your support!
So happy to help!
You’re most welcome! You can do it! Keep learning the concepts and then practice with past papers, you will do great! 👍🏻
Take brief notes, use diagrams (check out our helpful videos! 😊), practice past paper questions regularly. Begin with a small goal—just one question a day—and then slowly do more each day.
Thank you so much!
Most welcome 😊

Hi there. While watching the videos and making notes is a good idea, doing past exam papers and having a regular study schedule can really help you understand the test better and do even better. So make a study plan and consistently do past paper questions while revising and referring to our videos. Just start with at least doing one past paper question a day at first and slowly increase the number of questions to practice. You've got this, and you can achieve great results! ☺️
You’re most welcome! ☺️
Thank you for your appreciation! ☺️
Thank you so much for your appreciation! ☺️
@IGCSEStudyBuddy  ai is good ig😆❤

Hi @shushudana8756. Thank you for your inquiry. 🙂 These videos are aimed to guide you with a revision of each chapter. Since these videos are not intended to be detailed lessons, the limiting factors was only mentioned. Limiting factors are also part of the supplement syllabus content, which is covered in these videos but not in full detail.
Thank you for your continued support. Will be making content to cover all chapters, all very the best for your exams! :)
